channel.title: Question
channel.description:
[quote="baddy351, post:6, topic:400229"]No, u have a client, with the ip set to 127.0.0.1. Copy ur client, in that copy change the ip in it to ur no-ip. Zip the folder, upload, and other people use that. You use he one with he ip 127.0.0.1[/quote]
Why would I have to set my client to 127.0.0.1, and the other client that other use to my no-ip? I'm just wondering.

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @HonorScape HonorScape
item.description:
@HonorScape wrote:

[quote=“nsfpure, post:7, topic:400244”][quote author=HonorScape link=topic=497315.msg3637037#msg3637037 date=1308674965]
That doesn’t answer my question. My question is why I have to connect to my local host and not my no-ip?

What does it do if I connect to my local host?
[/quote]
Because you can’t connect to your own external IP. If you connect with localhost you just won’t lag[/quote]

OHHH, is that the only reason?

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @HonorScape HonorScape
item.description:
@HonorScape wrote:

baddy351:

127.0.0.1 is local host, so only u can connect. If someone else tried to do that, it would connect to their local host. The no-ip is so that people have an ip to connect to. No one but u can connect to your own local host.

But why do I have to connect to my local host? Why can’t I connect to my no-ip?

Read full topic

127.0.0.1 is local host, so only u can connect. If someone else tried to do that, it would connect to their local host. The no-ip is so that people have an ip to connect to. No one but u can connect to your own local host.

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @HonorScape HonorScape
item.description:
@HonorScape wrote:

I need help with rsps

No, u have a client, with the ip set to 127.0.0.1. Copy ur client, in that copy change the ip in it to ur no-ip. Zip the folder, upload, and other people use that. You use he one with he ip 127.0.0.1

Why would I have to set my client to 127.0.0.1, and the other client that other use to my no-ip? I’m just wondering.

Read full topic
